item.description: Al is a Perspective superimposed on Nature. It is a measurement of potential to a convergent point of with a limit of Bliss.
Alam is [[Am]] with [[Al]], and also the perspective of Alam. Alamic is an adjective for something Alam. Alamically is an adverb for something Alam.
Alamism is a framework for life centered around living in Bliss with the concepts of [[Alam]]. A practicioner is called an Alamist.
Noun: A self-identifying practitioner of [[Alam]] Adjective: Relating to Alamism An Alamist’s Vision is to live in Bliss through Alam.
Am is both anything and everything, including itself. ![[Heart#^definition]] The root of Am is Attachment, and can only exist with Perspective Harmony.
The core texts that underpin Alamism in its entirety. They are written in a way to be thought about during Introspection.
Attatchment, in a positive light, is healthy desire, acknowledgement, and Perspective. In a negative light, it is the opposite of Detatchment.
Bliss is a Perspective of trans-emotional tranquility, peace, and fulfillment of [[Alam]]. An Alamist lives in bliss through cultivating Al through Practice.
Detatchment is letting go of (unhealthy) desire, an application of Mindfulness. Detatchment is Alam, but if misunderstood as detatchment from happiness or peace, could be conversely disalamic.
Strong belief that Alam brings about Bliss, to the point where your mind can resist strong temptations and choose Alamic paths.
Introspection is utilizing Attachment and Visions via the Self to make plans for Nature to collapse into Bliss. This can often be done by studying Aphorisms and applying their messages.

In Alamism, mindfulness is concious Perspective without Self. This is achieved through Meditation (by definition). Meditation In Alamism, meditation only refers to one specific thing: Alamic Practice of mindfulness.

When used in Alamism “Nature” refers to Perspective of reality. Physics is perspective into the laws of Nature. In science, everything is considered “Nature” and thus everything follows a certain set of laws deterministically.
When various Perspectives disagree. Counterpart of Perspective Harmony.
When various Perspectives agree. Counterpart of Perspective Dissonance Alamism rejects absolute “truth” and replaces it with Perspective Harmony.
Perspectives are beliefs or assumptions. Any [[Am]] that assumes has perspective. Note that perspective does not require any kind of “thought.
Practice is action that changes the range or ease of actions. For example, going for a jog once is practice for going on a jog another time.

The concept of “self” is a Perspective brought about by what is called one’s concious. Through Nature, humans have a complicated array of perspectives arranged in a way capable of “thought,” on it’s own capable of perspective.

As opposed to “goals,” Visions are ideals meant to be sustained indefinitely. I suppose visions are goals, technically. When people think they have no goals or no purpose, they indeed have the goal to have goals.
